materials.raw_text: Cs: 30 g, Rb: 90 g, Sn: 60 g, Te: 200 g (Total: 380 g)

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in alkali metals. Rb: Available from chemical suppliers or specialty metal markets. Sn: Purchase from metal suppliers or online chemical retailers. Te: Sourced from elemental suppliers or online marketplaces.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in alkali metals. Rb: Available from chemical suppliers or specialty metal markets. Sn: Purchase from metal suppliers or online chemical retailers. Te: Sourced from elemental suppliers or online marketplaces.

1. In a clean, dry environment, measure out 30 g of cesium (Cs). 2. Measure 90 g of rubidium (Rb) and ensure it is in powdered form. 3. Measure 60 g of tin (Sn) in powder form. 4. Measure 200 g of tellurium (Te) in powder form. 5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 6. Use a spatula to thoroughly mix the powders to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a clean, dry environment, measure out 30 g of cesium (Cs). 2. Measure 90 g of rubidium (Rb) and ensure it is in powdered form. 3. Measure 60 g of tin (Sn) in powder form. 4. Measure 200 g of tellurium (Te) in powder form. 5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 6. Use a spatula to thoroughly mix the powders to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 800 °C (1472 °F). 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of Cs1Rb3Sn2Te10.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 800 °C (1472 °F). 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of Cs1Rb3Sn2Te10.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25 °C or 77 °F). 2. This cooling process should take about 6-8 hours to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25 °C or 77 °F). 2. This cooling process should take about 6-8 hours to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any surface imperfections or irregularities. 3. If necessary, use sandpaper (320 grit) to smooth the surface. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any surface imperfections or irregularities. 3. If necessary, use sandpaper (320 grit) to smooth the surface. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
